Description: Fragment of large pedestal base of East Greek pottery vase or stand; inside rough; outside, rectangular mouldings at top and bottom of face; turn to stem of vase just preserved. Frieze of dots on upper moulding, diagonals on lower; between band of dot rosettes of two types separated by sets of five dilute verticals; on top surface red-fired glaze or paint.
Curator's comments: 1924,1201.925 is a much larger example of the general type.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.815)
